block.p: Recent Sale $25.15 million
1251 Lexington Avenue (between 84th and 85th Streets) Manhattan
A real estate investment company has bought a 9,141-square-foot retail condo in this 1986 building.

Buyer: Joshua and Nathan Halegua, principals of Jonis Realty-Lexington Partners Buyer's broker: Alan S. Cohen, Brighton Advisors Seller: 150 E. 85th L.L.C. Seller's broker: Jeff Fishman, Robert K. Futterman & Associates
Recent Lease $40/sq. ft. approximate annual rent $172,000
Bush Tower 130 West 42nd Street Manhattan
A factoring group is moving its offices and operations from Hackensack, N.J., to the 26th floor of this 1916 29-story neo-Gothic building where it already has its headquarters.
Tenant: Platinum Funding Group Landlord: American Properties
For Sale $4 million
534 East 14th Street (between Avenues A and B) Manhattan
This five-story 7,246-square-foot mixed-use walk-up facing Stuyvesant Town has two stores and 15 rent-stabilized apartments. It also offers 3,070 square feet of air rights.
Owner: ADD Realty Co. Broker: Ross J. Mezzo and Timothy Unich, Marcus & Millichap
